author: Nick Timiraos
title: Fed Minutes Signal Greater Confidence in Reaching 2% Inflation
text:
WASHINGTONâ€”Federal Reserve officials at their meeting last month signaled greater confidence in reaching their 2% inflation target over the coming year and affirmed plans to continue raising short-term interest rates gradually.
They also debated the costs and benefits of allowing the economy to run hot and discussed how they might need to raise rates to a level that would deliberately restrict growth, according to minutes of their March 20-21 meeting, which were released Wednesday.
...
